greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A001222(A048675(n)).
comment: For n >= 3, a(n) = index of the row where n is located in array A277898.
link: Antti Karttunen (terms 2..3465) and Hans Havermann, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
program: from sympy import factorint, primepi, primefactors
def a001222(n): return 0 if n==1 else a001222(n//primefactors(n)[0]) + 1
return sum(f[i]*2**(primepi(i) - 1) for i in f)
print([a(n) for n in range(2, 101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 19 2017
xref: Cf. A277895 (ordinal transform from a(3) onward).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 08 2016
